tool.name: CreateArtificialSkyglowMap

param.name: ubr
param.displayname: Distance from site to night sky (km), relaxing increment

tool.summary:
Produce an aritificial sky glow map using local inputs and data from NASA and NOAA's Suomi NPP Visible Infrared Imaging Radiometer Suite (VIIRS) Day/Night Band (DNB) satellite sensor.

1. Input VIIRS Image File

2. Artificial skyglow maps require a kernel to process VIIRS images.

  • Create a kernel by inputting the region's latitude, distance from site to night sky, zenith angle, and azimuth angle. Choose where to save the TIFF file.

  • If kernel is already created, input the TIFF file and select a destination for new kernel TIFF file.
